title.narrative: 02-02 Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) AND PEDIATRIC AIDS

description.narrative: By end 2017, at least 90% of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARVs for Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) and the proportion of infected children, including adolescents living with HIV receiving anti retroviral treatment has increased by 15 points in the geographical areas contributing more than half of the unmet needs in Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) and pediatric AIDS, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children (including teenagers) and women especially the most vulnerable have access to and use the appropriate high- impact interventions to reduce transmission, morbidity and mortality related to HIV / AIDS and eliminate HIV transmission from mother to child.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, at least 90% of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARVs for PMTCT and the proportion of infected children,including adolescents living with HIV receiving anti retroviral treatment has increased by 15 points in the geographical areascontributing more than half of the unmet needs in PMTCT and pediatric AIDS

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the PNPCSP for the scaling up of PMTCT and pediatric care (PECP) through the intensification of integration of new sites offering ANC/PMTCT and Pediatric HIV care services. Consequently, the number of health centers/posts offering PMTCT services has increased from 313 in 2016 to 641 in 2017. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/12/2017
